free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduction to methods for the numerical solution of Schrödinger's equation. Application of these techniques to the computation of geometries, vibrational frequencies and electronic transitions.
free_text.Content: Molecular properties - Self-consistent field (SCF) calculations - Basis functions - Basis set superposition error (BSSE) - Electron correlation - Interative natural orbital method (INO) - Geometry - Vibrational frequencies - Electronic transi-tions/excited states - Performance and comparision of computational methods - Solvation
free_text.Keywords: ab initio molecular orbital methods, density functional theory
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic items in quantum chemistry and group theory

free_text.Contenu: Molecular properties - Self-consistent field (SCF) calculations - Basis functions - Basis set superposition error (BSSE) - Electron correlation - Interative natural orbital method (INO) - Geometry - Vibrational frequencies - Electronic transi-tions/excited states - Performance and comparision of computational methods - Solvation
free_text.Mots clés: ab initio molecular orbital methods, density functional theory
free_text.Prérequis: Basic items in quantum chemistry and group theory
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Introduction to methods for the numerical solution of Schrödinger's equation. Application of these techniques to the computation of geometries, vibrational frequencies and electronic transitions.
